name: Instance
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Bigtable.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/bigtable.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigtable = gcloud.bigtable();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigtable = gcloud.bigtable({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Instance
methods.description: Create an Instance object to interact with a Compute instance.

examples.code: var instance = bigtable.instance('my-instance');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: instance.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.code: instance.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: instance.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: metadata.displayName
params.description: • The descriptive name for this instance as it appears in UIs. It can be changed at any time, but should be kept globally unique to avoid confusion.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: name
params.description: • The name to be used when referring to the new cluster within its instance.

params.name: options.location
params.description: • The location where this cluster's nodes and storage reside. For best performance clients should be located as as close as possible to this cluster. Currently only zones are supported.

params.name: options.nodes
params.description: • The number of nodes allocated to this cluster. More nodes enable higher throughput and more consistent performance.

params.name: options.storage
params.description: • The type of storage used by this cluster to serve its parent instance's tables. Options are 'hdd' or 'ssd'.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createTable
methods.description: Create a table on your Bigtable instance.

examples.caption: Optionally specify column families to be created within the table.
You can also specify garbage collection rules for your column families. See bigtable/table#createFamily for more information about column families and garbage collection rules.
Pre-split the table based on the row key to spread the load across multiple Cloud Bigtable nodes.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.families
params.description: • Column families to be created within the table.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: cluster
methods.description: Get a reference to a Bigtable Cluster.

methods.name: getClusters
methods.description: Get Cluster objects for all of your clusters.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • Token returned from a previous call, to request the next page of results.

params.name: callback.error
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getClustersStream
methods.description: Get bigtable/cluster objects for all of your clusters as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See bigtable/instance#getClusters for a complete list of options.

methods.name: getTables
methods.description: Get Table objects for all the tables in your Compute instance.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of a larger set of results to view.

params.name: query.view
params.description: • View over the table's fields. Possible options are 'name', 'schema' or 'full'. Default: 'name'.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getTablesStream
methods.description: Get bigtable/table objects for all the tables in your Compute instance as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See bigtable/instance#getTables for a complete list of options.

methods.name: table
methods.description: Get a reference to a Bigtable table.

examples.code: var table = instance.table('presidents');
